grants-process.definition: Unlike VCs seeking ROI, foundation grants prioritize ecosystem impact
grants-process.example: A project creating open-source infrastructure that many can build upon

grants-process.definition: How well your project addresses a specific gap or need in the Avalanche ecosystem
grants-process.example: Building privacy solutions that enable real-world business transactions on Avalanche

grants-process.definition: Evidence that demonstrates your ability to execute and deliver on your roadmap
grants-process.example: A working prototype on Fuji testnet that shows core functionality

grants-process.definition: Applying for grants across multiple ecosystems without customization or commitment
grants-process.example: Submitting identical proposals to Avalanche, Solana, and Ethereum without blockchain-specific considerations

grants-process.definition: Connections and introductions provided by the foundation to help your project grow
grants-process.example: Getting introduced to institutional custodians that would be difficult to reach independently

community-building.term: Supply and Demand in Social Media
community-building.definition: Early-stage projects lack established demand and social capital
community-building.example: Instead of posting daily without purpose, focus on creating one highly valuable, educational post per week

community-building.definition: Breaking long-form content into multiple smaller formats
community-building.example: Converting a one-hour livestream into promotional clips, articles, social threads, and quote graphics

community-building.definition: Community involves active participation while audience merely observes
community-building.example: 100 active members discussing your project daily is more valuable than 10,000 silent followers

community-building.definition: Testing content ideas on a small scale before expanding
community-building.example: Avalanche tested a simple 'Triangle adoption' post to gauge community response before launching a full campaign

community-building.definition: A one-page document outlining an event's goals, audience, and success metrics
community-building.example: Creating a document specifying that a hackathon aims to generate 10 new project prototypes from senior developers
